question.title: What is the primary reason for hospitalizing an adult with a sudden onset of malaise and loss of consciousness?
question.description: A patient presents with sudden onset of malaise and loss of consciousness. What is the primary reason for hospitalization?

option_a.title: Electrolyte imbalance
option_a.description: The patient's electrolyte levels may be out of balance, leading to cardiac arrhythmias.

option_b.title: Cardiac arrhythmias
option_b.description: The patient's cardiac rhythm may be abnormal, requiring close monitoring.

option_c.title: Dehydration and hypovolemia
option_c.description: The patient may be dehydrated or have decreased blood volume, leading to decreased cardiac output.

option_d.title: Pulmonary embolism
option_d.description: The patient may have a blood clot in the lungs, which can cause sudden loss of consciousness.

correct_option.title: A
correct_option.description: The first letter of the correct option
